result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Joseph Bell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin Joseph Bell in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Benjamin Joseph Bell.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD. Matter set for plea and sentencing.  Due to court calendar, matter must be adjourned. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Case recalled.  Same appearances.  State has made a new offer to the defense and counsel requests a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Bell in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Benjamin Joseph Bell.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Bell in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Benjamin Joseph Bell.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Final pretrial conference held.  Parties remain in trial posture. State put their offer on the record which was rejected by the defendant.  Jury trial remains scheduled on 9/26/22 in Branch 1.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Bell in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status conference held.  Atty. Plaisted requests a final pretrial and trial date.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court informed the parties that good faith negotiation are to be held before the final pretrial and parties should be prepared to inform the Court if the case is going to proceed to trial or if it is going to resolve. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Bell in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Plaisted has received discovery and requests time to review it.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with E.S.R.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Benjamin Joseph Bell in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Benjamin Joseph Bell in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Benjamin Joseph Bell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
